intro: Conchocarpus cuneifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed conchocarpus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with five petals and stamens. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many plants in the Malvaceae family.
